au.com.innodev.wmboost.data

Interface SplitEntry<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - element type
    All Superinterfaces:
    HasKey

    public interface SplitEntry<E>
extends HasKey
    Allows access and modification of a group of entries that share the same key.

    Use it in cases where you need to process all entries, such as deserialised XML list. For most common uses cases, use a unit entry, i.e., ItemEntry or CollectionEntry.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getKey()
      Returns the key associated to the entry being referenced
      List<E> getNonEmptyVal()
      Returns a non-empty list of values in the split entry.

      void putConverted(Iterable<?> values)
      Sets or replaces all values in the split entry with the provided ones.
      void remove()
      Removes all values in the split entry in strict mode.
      void remove(RemoveEntryOption removeOption)
      Removes all values in the split entry.

      • getNonEmptyVal

        List<E> getNonEmptyVal()
                throws InexistentEntryException
        Returns a non-empty list of values in the split entry.

        Returns:
        a non-null, non-empty list
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key

      • getValOrEmpty

        List<E> getValOrEmpty()
        Returns the values in the split entry. If there are no entries with the key, an empty collection is returned.
        Returns:
        a non-null list

      • put

        void put(Iterable<? extends E> values)
        Sets or replaces all values in the split entry with the provided ones.
        Parameters:
        values - new values for the split entry

      • putConverted

        void putConverted(Iterable<?> values)
        Sets or replaces all values in the split entry with the provided ones.

        Use this method in cases where the value type is different to the type you want to be stored in the entry. For example, if you wanted a list of integers 5 and 8 to be stored as a String in the entry, you could use the following code: 

         List<Integer> list = new ArrayList<Integer>();
 list.add(5);
 list.add(8);
 doc.stringsSplitEntry("values").putConverted(list);
        Parameters:
        values - new values for the split entry

      • remove

        void remove()
        Removes all values in the split entry in strict mode.
        See Also:
        remove(RemoveEntryOption)

      • remove

        void remove(RemoveEntryOption removeOption)
        Removes all values in the split entry.

        Note that type used for the entry (e.g. String) is not taken into account when removing the entry. It's only done by key.

        Because this is an entry reference that takes into account all entries associated to a key, it removes all of those entries.
